party policy and principle be not want to urge prompt and effective action both of the great political party now represent in the government have by repeat and authoritative declaration condemn the condition of our law which permit the collection from the people of unnecessary revenue and have in the most solemn manner promise its correction and neither as citizen nor partisan be our countryman in a mood to condone the deliberate violation of these pledge our progress toward a wise conclusion will not be improve by dwell upon the theory of protection and free trade this savor too much of bandy epithet it be a condition which confront we not a theory relief from this condition may involve a slight reduction of the advantage which we award our home production but the entire withdrawal of such advantage should not be contemplate the question of free trade be absolutely irrelevant and the persistent claim make in certain quarter that all the effort to relieve the people from unjust and unnecessary taxation be scheme of so call free trader be mischievous and far removed from any consideration for the public good the simple and plain duty which we owe the people be to reduce taxation to the necessary expense of an economical operation of the government and to restore to the business of the country the money which we hold in the treasury through the perversion of governmental power these thing can and should be do with safety to all our industry without danger to the opportunity for remunerative labor which our workingman need and with benefit to they and all our people by cheapen their mean of subsistence and increase the measure of their comfort the constitution provide that the president shall from time to time give to the congress information of the state of the union it have be the custom of the executive in compliance with this provision to annually exhibit to the congress at the opening of its session the general condition of the country and to detail with some particularity the operation of the different executive departments it would be especially agreeable to follow this course at the present time and to call attention to the valuable accomplishment of these departments during the last fiscal year but i be so much impressed with the paramount importance of the subject to which this communication have thus far be devoted that i shall forego the addition of any other topic and only urge upon your immediate consideration the state of the union as show in the present condition of our treasury and our general fiscal situation upon which every element of our safety and prosperity depend the report of the head of departments which will be submit contain full and explicit information touch the transaction of the business intrust to they and such recommendation relate to legislation in the public interest as they deem advisable i ask for these report and recommendation the deliberate examination and action of the legislative branch of the government there be other subject not embrace in the departmental report demand legislative consideration and which i should be glad to submit some of they however have be earnestly present in previous message and as to they i beg leave to repeat prior recommendation as the law make no provision for any report from the department of state a brief history of the transaction of that important department together with other matter which it may hereafter be deem essential to commend to the attention of the congress may furnish the occasion for a future communication
revised civil service rule
 executive mansion february 2 1888
 in the exercise of power vest in he by the constitution and of authority give to he by the seventeen hundred and fifty third section of the revised statutes and by an act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883 the president hereby make and promulgate the follow rule and revoke the rule know as amended civil service rules and special rule no 1 heretofore promulgate under the power and authority refer to herein provide that this revocation shall not be construe as an exclusion from the classified civil service of any now classified custom district or classified post office
 general rules
 general rule i.
 any officer in the executive civil service who shall use his official authority or influence for the purpose of interfere with an election or control the result thereof or who shall dismiss or cause to be dismiss or use influence of any kind to procure the dismissal of any person from any place in the say service because such person have refuse to be coerce in his political action or have refuse to contribute money for political purpose or have refuse to render political service and any officer clerk or other employee in the executive civil service who shall willfully violate any of these rule or any of the provision of section 11 12 13 and 14 of the act entitle an act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883 shall be dismiss from office
 general rule ii
 there shall be three branch of the classified civil service as follow
 1 the classified departmental service
 2 the classified custom service
 3 the classified postal service
 general rule iii
 i. no person shall be appoint or employ to enter the civil service classify in accordance with section 163 of the revised statutes and under the act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883 until he shall have pass an examination or shall have be show to be specially exempt therefrom by say act or by an exception to this rule set forth in connection with the rule regulate admission to the branch of the service he seek to enter
 2 no noncompetitive examination shall be hold except under the following condition
 a the failure of competent person to be after due notice competitively examine thus make it impracticable to supply to the appoint officer in due time the name of person who have pass a competitive examination
 b that a person have be during one year or long in a place except from examination and the appoint or nominating officer desire the appointment of such person to a place not excepted
 c that a person have serve two year continuously since july 16 1883 in a place in the departmental service below or outside the classified service and the appoint officer desire with the approval of the president upon the recommendation of the commission to promote such person into the classified service because of his faithfulness and efficiency in the position occupy by he and because of his qualification for the place to which the appoint officer desire his promotion
 d that an appoint or nominating officer desire the examination of a person to test his fitness for a classified place which might be fill under exception to examination declare in connection with the rule regulate admission to the classified service
 e that the commission with the approval of the president have decide that such an examination should be hold to test fitness for any particular place require technical professional or scientific knowledge special skill or peculiar ability to test fitness for which place a competitive examination can not in the opinion of the commission be properly provide
 f that a person who have be appoint from the copyist register wish to take the clerk examination for promotion to a place the salary of which be not less than $ 1,000 per annum
 g to test the fitness of a person for a place to which his transfer have be request
 h when the exigency of the service require such examination for promotion as provide by clause 6 of this rule
 3 all application for examination must be make in form and manner prescribe by the commission
 4 no person serve in the army or navy shall be examine for admission to the classified service until the write consent of the head of the department under which he be enlist shall have be communicate to the commission
 no person who be an applicant for examination or who be an eligible in one branch of the classified service shall at the same time be an applicant for examination in any other branch of say service
 5 the commission may refuse to examine an applicant who would be physically unable to perform the duty of the place to which he desire appointment the reason for any such action must be enter on the minute of the commission
 6 for the purpose of establish in the classified civil service the principle of compulsory competitive examination for promotion there shall be so far as practicable and useful compulsory competitive examination of a suitable character to test fitness for promotion but person in the classified service who be honorably discharge from the military or naval service of the united states and the widow and orphan of deceased soldier and sailor shall be exempt from such examination
 the commission may make regulation apply they to any part of the classified service under which regulation all examination for promotion therein shall be conduct and all promotion be make but until regulation in accordance herewith have be apply to any part of the classified service promotion therein shall be make in the manner provide by the rules applicable thereto and in any part of the classified service in which promotion be make under examination as herein provide the commission may in special case if the exigency of the service require such action provide noncompetitive examination for promotion
 person who be in the classified civil service on july 16 1883 and person who have be since that date or may be hereafter put into that service by the inclusion of subordinate place clerk and officer under the provision of section 6 of the act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883 shall be entitle to all right of promotion possess by person of the same class or grade appoint after examination under the act refer to above
 7 no question in any examination shall be so frame as to elicit information concern the political or religious opinion or affiliation of competitor and no discrimination in examination certification or appointment shall be make by the commission the examiner or the appointing or nominating officer in favor of or against any applicant competitor or eligible because of his political or religious opinion or affiliation the commission the examiner and the appointing or nominating officer shall discountenance all disclosure of such opinion or affiliation by or concern any applicant competitor or eligible and any appoint or nominating officer who shall make inquiry concern or in any other way attempt to ascertain the political or religious opinion or affiliation of any eligible or who shall discriminate in favor of or against any eligible because of the eligible&#39;s political or religious opinion or affiliation shall be dismiss from office
 8 every applicant must state under oath--
 a his full name
 b that he be a citizen of the united states
 c year and place of his birth
 d the state territory or district of which he be a bona fide resident and the length of time he have be a resident thereof
 e his post office address
 f his business or employment during the three year immediately precede the date of his application and where he have reside each of those year
 g condition of his health and his physical capacity for the public service
 h his previous employment in the public service
 i any right of preference in civil appointment he may claim under section 1754 of the revised statutes
 j the kind of school in which he receive his education
 k that he do not habitually use intoxicate beverage to excess
 l that he have not within the one year next precede the date of his application be dismiss from the public service for delinquency or misconduct
 m such other fact as the commission may require
 9 every applicant for examination for the classified departmental service must support the statement of his application paper by certificate of person acquaint with he resident of the state territory or district in which he claim bona fide residence and the commission shall prescribe the form and number of such certificate
 10 a false statement make by an applicant or connivance by he with any person to make on his behalf a false statement in any certificate require by the commission and deception or fraud practice by an applicant or by any person on his behalf with his consent to influence an examination shall be good cause for refusal to examine such applicant or for refuse to mark his paper after examination
 11 all examination shall be prepare and conduct under the supervision of the commission and examination paper shall be mark under rule make by the commission which shall take care that the mark examiner do not know the name of any competitor in an examination for admission whose paper be intrust to they
 12 for the purpose of mark examination paper board of examiner shall be appoint by the commission one to be know as the central board which shall be compose of person in the classified service who shall be detail for constant duty at the office of the commission under supervision of the commission the central board shall mark the paper of the copyist and of the clerk examination and such of the paper of the supplementary special and promotion examination for the departmental service and of examination for admission to or promotion in the other branch of the classified service as shall be submit to it by the commission
 13 no person shall be appoint to membership on any board of examiner until after the commission shall have consult with the head of the department or of the office under whom such person be serve
 14 an examiner shall be allow time during office hour to perform his duty as examiner which duty shall be consider part of his official duty
 15 the commission may change the membership of board of examiner and--
 a prescribe the manner of organize such board
 b more particularly define their power
 c specifically determine their duty and the duty of the member thereof
 16 each board shall keep such record and make such report as the commission may require and such record shall be open to the inspection of any member of this commission or other person act under authority of the commission which may for the purpose of investigation take possession of such record
 general rule iv
 1 the name of all competitor who shall successfully pass an examination shall be enter upon a register and the competitor whose name have be thus register shall be eligible to any office or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 2 the commission may refuse to certify--
 a an eligible who be so defective in sight speech or hearing or who be otherwise so defective physically as to be apparently unfit to perform the duty of the position to which he be seek appointment
 b an eligible who have make a false statement in his application or be guilty of fraud or deceit in any matter connect with his application or examination or who have be guilty of a crime or of infamous or notoriously disgraceful conduct
 3 if an appoint or nominating officer to whom certification have be make shall object in write to any eligible name in the certificate state that because of physical incapacity or for other good cause particularly specify such eligible be not capable of properly perform the duty of the vacant place the commission may upon investigation and ascertainment of the fact that the objection make be good and well rounded direct the certification of another eligible in place of the one to whom objection have be make
 general rule v.
 executive officer shall in all proper way facilitate civil service examination and custom officer postmaster and custodian of public building at place where such examination be to be hold shall for the purpose of such examination permit and arrange for the use of suitable room under their charge and for heating lighting and furnish the same
 general rule vi
 no person dismiss for misconduct and no probationer who have fail to receive absolute appointment or employment shall be admit to any examination within one year after having be thus discharge from the service
 general rule vii
 i. persons who have a prima facie claim of preference for appointment to civil office under section 1754 revised statutes shall be prefer in certification make under the authority of the commission to any appoint or nominate officer
 2 in make any reduction of force in any branch of the classified civil service those person shall be retain who be equally qualified have be honorably discharge from the military or naval service of the united states and also the widow and orphan of deceased soldier and sailor
 general rule viii
 the commission shall have authority to prescribe regulation under and in accordance with these general rule and the rule relate specially to each of the several branch of the classified service
 departmental rule
 departmental rule i.
 1 the classified departmental service shall include the several officer clerk and other person in any department commission or bureau at washington classify under section 163 of the revised statutes or by direction of the president for the purpose of the examination prescribe by the civil service act of 1883 or for facilitate the inquiry as to fitness of candidate for admission to the departmental service in respect to age health character knowledge and ability as provide for in section 1753 of the revised statutes
 2 the word department when use in the general or departmental rule shall be construe to mean any such department commission or bureau classify as above prescribe
 departmental rule ii
 1 to test the fitness of applicant for admission to the classified departmental service there shall be examination as follow
 copyist examination --for place of $ 900 per annum and under this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction and percentage
 clerk examination --for place of $ 1,000 per annum and upward this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction percentage interest and discount
 e element of bookkeeping and of account
 f element of the english language
 g letter write
 h element of the geography history and government of the united states
 supplementary examination --for place which in the opinion of the commission require in addition to the knowledge require to pass the copyist or the clerk examination certain technical professional or scientific knowledge or knowledge of a language other than the english language or peculiar or special skill
 special examinations.--for place which in the opinion of the commission require certain technical professional or scientific knowledge or skill each special examination shall embrace in addition to the special subject upon which the applicant be to be test as many of the subject of the clerk examination as the commission may decide to be necessary to test fitness for the place to be fill
 noncompetitive examination --for any place in the departmental service for which the commission may from time to time subject to the condition prescribe by general rule iii clause 2 determine that such examination ought to be hold
 2 an applicant may take the copyist or the clerk examination and any or all of the supplementary and special examination provide for the departmental service subject to such limitation as the commission may by regulation prescribe but no person whose name be on a departmental register of eligible shall during the period of his eligibility be allow reexamination unless he shall satisfy the commission that at the time of his examination he be unable because of illness or other good cause to do himself justice in say examination and the rating upon such reexamination shall cancel and be a substitute for the rating of such person upon the previous examination
 3 exception from examination in the classified departmental service be hereby make as follow
 a one private secretary or one confidential clerk of the head of each classified department and of each assistant secretary thereof and also of each head of bureau appoint by the president by and with the advice and consent of the senate
 b direct custodian of money for whose fidelity another officer be under official bond but this exception shall not include any officer below the grade of assistant cashier or assistant teller
 c disbursing officer who give bond
 d person employ exclusively in the secret service of the government
 e chief clerk
 f chiefs of division
 4 no person appoint to a place under the exception to examination hereby make shall within one year after appointment be transfer from such place to a place not also except from examination but after service of not less than one year in an examination except place he may be transfer in the bureau in which he be serve to a place not except from examination provide that before any such transfer may be make the commission must certify that the person whom it be propose to so transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place propose to be fill by such transfer
 departmental rule iii
 in compliance with the provision of section 3 of the civil service act the commission shall provide examination for the classified departmental service at least twice in each year in every state or territory in which there be a sufficient number of applicant for such examination and the place and time of examination shall when practicable be so fix that each applicant may know at the time of make his application when and where he may be examine but applicant may be notify to appear at any place at which the commission may order an examination
 departmental rule iv
 i. any person not under 20 year of age may make application for admission to the classified departmental service blank form for which purpose shall be furnish by the commission
 2 every application for admission to the classified departmental service should be address as follow united states civil service commission washington d.c.
 3 the date of reception and also of approval by the commission of each application shall be note on the application paper
 departmental rule v.
 1 the paper of all examination for admission to or promotion in the classified departmental service shall be mark as direct by the commission
 2 the commission shall have authority to appoint the follow name board of examiner which shall conduct examination and mark examination paper as follow
 central board --as provide for by general rule iii clause 12
 special board --these board shall mark such paper of special examination for the classified departmental service as the commission may direct and shall be compose of person in the public service
 supplementary board .--these board shall mark the paper of such supplementary examination for the classified departmental service as the commission may direct and shall be compose of person in the public service
 promotion boards.--one for each department of three member and one auxillary member for each bureau of the department for which the board be to act unless the commission shall otherwise direct these board shall mark the paper of promotion examination
 local boards.- -these board shall be organize at one or more place in each state and territory where examination for the classified departmental service be to be hold and shall conduct such examination and each shall be compose of person in the public service reside in the state or territory in which the board be to act
 customs and postal board these board shall conduct such examination for the classified departmental service as the commission shall direct
 departmental rule vi
 1 the paper of the copyist and of the clerk examination shall be mark by the central board the paper of special and supplementary examination shall be mark as direct by the commission each competitor in any of the examination mention or refer to above shall be grade on a scale of 100 accord to the general average determine by the mark make by the examiner on his paper
 2 the paper of an examination having be mark the commission shall ascertain--
 a the name of every competitor who have under section 1754 of the revised statutes claim of preference in civil appointment and who have attain a general average of not less than 65 per cent and all such competitor be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 b the name of every other competitor who have attain a general average of not less than 70 per cent and all such competitor be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 3 the name of all preference claim competitor whose general average be not less than 65 per cent together with the name of all other competitor whose general average be not less than 70 per cent shall be enter upon the register of person eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 4 to facilitate the maintenance of the apportionment of appointment among the several states and territories and the district of columbia require by section 2 of the act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883 there shall be list of eligible for each state and territory and for the district of columbia upon which shall be enter the name of the competitor from that state or territory or the district of columbia who have pass the copyist and the clerk examination the name of those who have pass the copyist examination and of those who have pass the clerk examination be list separately the name of male and of female eligible in such examination be also list separately
 5 but the name of all competitor who have pass a supplementary or a special examination shall be enter without regard to state residence upon the register of person eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which supplementary or special examination be hold
 6 the grade of each competitor shall be express by the whole number near the general average attain by he and the grade of each eligible shall be note upon the register of eligible in connection with his name when two or more eligible be of the same grade preference in certification shall be determine by the order in which their application paper be file
 7 immediately after the general average in an examination shall have be ascertain each competitor shall be notify that he have pass or have fail to pass
 8 if a competitor fail to pass he may with the consent of the commission be allow reexamination at any time within six month from the date of failure without file a new application but a competitor fail to pass desire to take again the same examination must if not allow reexamination within six month from the date of failure make in due form a new application therefor
 9 no person who have pass an examination shall while eligible on the register supply by such examination be reexamine unless he shall furnish evidence satisfactory to the commission that at the time of his examination he be because of illness or other good cause incapable of do himself justice in say examination
 10 the term of eligibility to appointment under the copyist and the clerk examination shall be one year from the day on which the name of the eligible be enter on the register the term of eligibility under a supplementary or a special examination shall be determine by the commission but shall not be less than one year
 departmental rule vii
 1 vacancy in the classified departmental service unless among the place except from examination if not fill by either promotion or transfer shall be fill in the following manner
 a the appoint officer shall in form and manner to be prescribe by the commission request the certification to he of the name of either male or female eligible to a certain place then vacant
 b if fitness for the place to be fill be test by competitive examination the commission shall certify the name of three male or three female these name to be those of the eligible who stand higher in grade than any other three eligible of the same sex on the list of eligible from which certification be to be make have not be certify three time to the officer make the requisition provide that if upon any register from which certification be to be make there be the name of eligible who have under section 1754 of the revised statutes claim of preference in civil appointment the name of such eligible shall be certify before the name of other eligible higher in grade the commission shall make regulation that will secure to each of such preference claim eligible in the order of his grade among other preference claimant an opportunity to have his claim of preference consider and determine by the appoint officer
 2 certification hereunder shall be make in such manner as to maintain as nearly as possible the apportionment of appointment among the several states and the territories and the district of columbia as require by law
 3 if the three name certify be those of person eligible on the copyist or the clerk register the appoint officer shall select one and one only and shall notify the person whose name have be select that he have be designate for appointment provide that for the purpose of maintain the apportionment of appointment refer to in clause 2 of this rule the commission may authorize the appoint officer to select more than one of the three name certify
 when certification be make from a supplementary or a special register and there be more vacancy than one to be fill the appoint officer may select from the three name certify more than one
 4 the commission may certify from the clerk register for appointment to a place the salary of which be less than $ 1,000 per annum any eligible on say register who have give write notice that he will accept such a place
 5 when a person designate for appointment shall have report in person to the appoint officer he shall be appoint for a probational period of six month at the end of which period if his conduct and capacity be satisfactory to the appoint officer he shall receive absolute appointment but if his conduct and capacity be not satisfactory to say officer he shall be notify that he will not receive absolute appointment and this notification shall discharge he from the service the appoint officer shall require the head of bureaus or division under whom probationer be serve to keep a record and to make report of the punctuality industry habit ability and aptitude of each probationer
 6 all person appoint to or promote in the classified departmental service shall be assign to the duty of the class or place to which they have be appoint or promote unless the interest of the service require their assignment to other duty and when such assignment be make the fact shall be report to the head of the department
 departmental rule viii
 1 transfer will be make as follow
 a from one department to another upon requisition by the head of the department to which the transfer be to be make
 b from a bureau of the treasury department in which business relate to the custom be transact to a classified custom district and from such a district to such a bureau of the treasury department upon requisition by the secretary of the treasury
 c from the post office department to a classified post office and from such an office to the post office department upon requisition by the postmaster general
 2 no person may be transfer as herein authorize until the commission shall have certify to the officer make the transfer requisition that the person whom it be propose to transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place to which he be to be transfer and that such person have during at least six month precede the date of the certificate be in the classified service of the department custom district or post office from which the transfer be to be make provide that no person who have be appoint from the copyist register shall be transfer to a place the salary of which be more than $ 900 per annum until one year after appointment
 departmental rule ix
 i. a person appoint from the copyist register may upon any test of fitness determine upon by the promote officer be promote as follow
 a at any time after probational appointment to any place the salary of which be not more than $ 900 per annum
 b at any time after one year from the date of probational appointment upon certification by the commission that he have pass the clerk examination or its equivalent to any place the salary of which be $ 1,000 per annum or more
 c at any time after two year from the date of probational appointment to any place the salary of which be $ 1,000 per annum or more
 2 a person appoint front the clerk register or from any supplementary or special register to a place the salary of which be $ 1,000 per annum or more may upon any test of fitness determine upon by the promote officer be promote at any time after absolute appointment
 3 a person appoint from the clerk register or from any supplementary or special register to a place the salary of which be $ 900 or less may upon any test of fitness determine upon by the promote officer be promote at any time after probational appointment to any place the salary of which be $ 1,000 per annum
 4 other promotion may be make upon any test of fitness determine upon by the promote officer
 5 the provision of clause 1 2 3 and 4 of this rule shall become null and void in any part of the classified departmental service be soon as promotion regulation shall have be apply thereto under general rule iii clause 6
 departmental rule x.
 upon requisition of the head of a department the commission shall certify for reinstatement in say department in a grade require no high examination than the one in which he be formerly employ any person who within one year next precede the date of the requisition have through no delinquency or misconduct be separate from the classified service of that department
 departmental rule xi
 each appoint officer in the classified departmental service shall report to the commission--
 a every probational and every absolute appointment make by he and every appointment make by he under any exception to examination authorize by departmental rule ii clause 3
 b every refusal by he to make an absolute appointment and every refusal or neglect to accept an appointment in the classified service under he
 c every transfer within and into the classified service under he
 d every assignment of a person to the performance of the duty of a class or place to which such person be not appoint
 e every separation from the classified service under he and whether the separation be cause by dismissal resignation or death place except from examination be within the classified service
 f every restoration to the classified service under he of any person who may have be separate therefrom by dismissal or resignation
 customs rule
 customs rule i.
 1 the classified custom service shall include the officer clerk and other person in the several custom district classify under the provision of section 6 of the act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883
 2 whenever the officer clerk and other person in any custom district number as many as fifty any exist classification of the custom service make by the secretary of the treasury under section 6 of the act of january 16 1883 shall apply thereto and thereafter the commission shall provide examination to test the fitness of person to fill vacancy in say custom district and these rule shall be in force therein every revision of the classification of any custom office under section 6 of the act above mention and every inclusion within the classified custom service of a custom district shall be report to the president
 customs rule ii
 1 to test fitness for admission to the classified custom service examination shall be provide as follow
 clerk examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 storekeeper shall be class as clerk and vacancy in that class shall be fill by assignment
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction percentage interest and discount
 e element of bookkeeping and of account
 f element of the english language
 g letter write
 h element of the geography history and government of the united states
 law clerk examination.--this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction percentage interest and discount
 e element of the english language
 f letter write
 g law question
 day inspector examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction and percentage
 e element of the english language
 f geography of america and europe
 inspectress examination.--this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule
 e geography of america and europe
 night inspector messenger assistant weigher and opener and packer examination.--this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule
 gauger examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic practical question
 e theoretical question
 f practical test
 examiner examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction percentage and discount
 e element of the english language
 f practical question
 g practical test
 sampler examination .--this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule
 e practical question
 f practical test
 other competitive examinations.--such other competitive examination as the commission may from time to time determine to be necessary in test fitness for other place in the classified custom service
 noncompetitive examinations.--such examination may with the approval of the commission be hold under condition state in general rule iii clause 2
 2 any person not under 21 year of age may be examine for any place in the custom service to test fitness for which an examination be prescribe and any person not under 20 year of age may be examine for clerk or messenger
 3 a person desire examination for admission to the classified custom service must make request in his own handwriting for a blank form of application which request and also his application shall be address as direct by the commission
 4 the date of reception and also of approval by the board of each of such application shall be note on the application paper
 5 exception from examination in the classified custom service be hereby make as follow
 a deputy collector who do not also act as inspector examiner or clerk
 b cashier of the collector
 c assistant cashier of the collector
 d auditor of the collector
 e chief act disbursing officer
 f deputy naval officer
 g deputy surveyor
 h one private secretary or one confidential clerk of each nominate officer
 6 no person appoint to a place under any exception to examination hereby make shall within one year after appointment be transfer from such place to another place not also except from examination but a person who have serve not less than one year in an examination except place may be transfer in the custom office in which he be serve to a place not except from examination provide that before any such transfer may be make the commission must certify that the person whom it be propose to so transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place propose to be fill by such transfer
 customs rule iii
 1 the paper of every examination shall be mark under direction of the commission and each competitor shall be grade on a scale of 100 accord to the general average determine by the mark make by the examiner on his paper
 2 the commission shall appoint in each classified custom district a board of examiner which shall--
 a conduct all examination hold to test fitness for admission to or promotion in the classified service of the custom district in which the board be locate
 b mark the paper of such examination unless otherwise direct as provide for by general rule iii clause 12
 c conduct such examination for the classified departmental service as the commission may direct
 3 the paper of an examination having be mark the board of examiner shall ascertain--
 a the name of every competitor who have under section 1754 of the revised statutes claim of preference in civil appointment and who have attain a general average of not less than 65 per cent and all such competitor be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 b the name of every other competitor who have attain a general average of not less than 70 per cent and all such applicant be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 4 the name of all preference claim competitor whose general average be not less than 65 per cent together with the name of all other competitor whose general average be not less than 70 per cent shall be enter upon the register of person eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold the name of male and of female eligible shall be list separately
 5 the grade of each competitor shall be express by the whole number near the general average attain by he and the grade of each eligible shall be note upon the register of eligible in connection with his name when two or more eligible be of the same grade preference in certification shall be determine by the order in which their application paper be file
 6 immediately after the general average in an examination shall have be ascertain each competitor shall be notify that he have pass or have fail to pass
 7 if a competitor fail to pass he may with the consent of the board approve by the commission be allow reexamination at any time within six month from the date of failure without file a new application but a competitor fail to pass desire to take again the same examination must if not allow reexamination within six month from the date of failure make in due form a new application therefor
 8 no person who have pass an examination shall while eligible on the register supply by such examination be reexamine unless he shall furnish evidence satisfactory to the commission that at the time of his examination he be because of illness or for other good cause incapable of do himself justice in say examination
 9 the term of eligibility to appointment in the classified custom service shall be one year from the day on which the name of the eligible be enter on the register
 customs rule iv
 1 vacancy in the low class or grade of the classified service of a custom district shall be fill in the following manner
 a the nominate officer in any office in which a vacancy may exist shall in form and manner to be prescribe by the commission request the board of examiner to certify to he the name of either male or female eligible to the vacant place
 b if fitness for the place to be fill be test by competitive examination the board of examiner shall certify the name of three male or three female these name to be those of the eligible who stand higher in grade than any other three eligible of the same sex on the register from which certification be to be make have not be certify three time from said register provide that if upon say register there be the name of eligible who under section 1754 of the revised statutes have claim of preference in civil appointment the name of such eligible shall be certify before the name of other eligible higher in grade the commission shall make regulation that will secure to each of such preference claim eligible in the order of his grade among other preference claimant an opportunity to have his claim of preference consider and determine by the appoint officer
 c each name on a register of eligible may be certify only three time provide that when a name have be three time certify if there be not three name on the register of high grade it may upon the write request of a nominate officer to whom it have not be certify be include in any certification make to say officer
 2 of the three name certify the nominate officer must select one and if at the time of make this selection there be more vacancy than one he may select more than one name each person thus designate for appointment shall be notify and upon report in person to the proper officer shall be appoint for a probational period of six month at the end of which period if his conduct and capacity be satisfactory to the nominate officer he shall receive absolute appointment but if his conduct and capacity be not satisfactory to say officer he shall be notify that he will not receive absolute appointment and this notification shall discharge he from the service
 3 every nominate officer in the classified custom service shall require the officer under whom a probationer may be serve to carefully observe and report in write the service render by and the character and qualification of such probationer these report shall be preserve on file and the commission may prescribe the form and manner in which they shall be make
 4 all other vacancy unless among the place except from examination shall be fill by transfer or promotion
 customs rule v.
 1 until promotion regulation have be apply to a classified custom district the follow promotion may be make therein at any time after absolute appointment
 a a clerk upon any test of fitness determine upon by the nominate officer to any vacant place in the class next above the one in which he may be serve
 b a day inspector upon any test of fitness determine upon by the nominate officer to class 2 in the grade of clerk
 c a clerk day inspector opener and packer or sampler after pass the examiner examination to the grade of examiner
 d a messenger after pass the clerk examination to the low class in the grade of clerk
 e a night inspector after pass the day inspector examination to the grade of day inspector
 2 other promotion may be make in the discretion of the promote officer upon any test of fitness determine upon by he
 customs rule vi
 1 transfer may be make as follow
 a from one office of a classified district to another office in the same district subject to the provision of customs rule v.
 b from one classified district to another upon requisition by the secretary of the treasury
 c from any bureau of the treasury department in which business relate to custom be transact to any classified custom district and from any such district to any such bureau upon requisition by the secretary of the treasury
 2 no person may be transfer as herein authorize until the board of examiner act under a of clause i or until the commission act under b or c of clause 1 of this rule shall have certify to the officer make the transfer requisition that the person whom it be propose to transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place to which he be to be transfer and that such person have be at least six month precede the date of the certificate in the classified service of the department or custom district from which the transfer be to be make
 customs rule vii
 upon requisition of a nominate officer in any custom district the board of examiner thereof shall certify for reinstatement in any office under his jurisdiction in a grade require no high examination than the one in which he be formerly employ any person who within one year next precede the date of the requisition have through no delinquency or misconduct be separate from the classified service of say office
 customs rule viii
 each nominate officer of a classified custom district shall report to the board of examiners--
 a every probational and absolute appointment and every appointment under any exception to examination authorize by customs rule ii clause 5 make within his jurisdiction
 b every refusal by he to nominate a probationer for absolute appointment and every refusal or neglect to accept an appointment in the classified service under he
 c every transfer into the classified service under he
 d every separation from the classified service under he and whether the separation be cause by dismissal resignation or death place except from examination be within the classified service
 e every restoration to the classified service under he of any person who may have be separate therefrom by dismissal or resignation
 postal rule
 postal rule i.
 1 the classified postal service shall include the officer clerk and other person in the several post office classify under the provision of section 6 of the act to regulate and improve the civil service of the united states approve january 16 1883
 2 whenever the officer clerk and other person in any post office number as many as fifty any exist classification of the postal service make by the postmaster general under section 6 of the act of january 16 1883 shall apply thereto and thereafter the commission shall provide examination to test the fitness of person to fill vacancy in say post office and these rule shall be in force therein every revision of the classification of any post office under section 6 of the act above mention and every inclusion of a post office within the classified postal service shall be report to the president
 postal rule ii
 1 to test fitness for admission to the classified postal service examination shall be provide as follow
 clerk examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule fraction and percentage
 e element of the english language
 f letter write
 g element of the geography history and government of the united states
 carrier examination --this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule
 e element of the geography of the united states
 f knowledge of the locality of the post office delivery
 g physical test
 messenger examination.--this examination shall not include more than the follow subject
 a orthography
 b copying
 c penmanship
 d arithmetic fundamental rule
 e physical test
 this examination shall also be use to test fitness for the position of piler stamper junior clerk or other place the duty of which be chiefly manual
 special examinations.--these examination shall test fitness for position require knowledge of a language other than the english language or special or technical knowledge or skill each special examination shall include in addition to the special subject upon which the applicant be to be test so many of the subject of the clerk examination as the commission may determine
 noncompetitive examinations.--such examination may with the approval of the commission be hold under condition state in general rule iii clause 2
 2 no person shall be examine for the position of clerk if under 18 year of age and no person shall be examine for the position of messenger stamper or junior clerk if under 16 or over 45 year of age and no person shall be examine for the position of carrier if under 21 or over 40 year of age no person shall be examine for any other position in the classified postal service if under 18 or over 45 year of age
 3 any person desire examination for admission to the classified postal service must make request in his own handwriting for a blank form of application which request and also his application shall be address as direct by the commission
 4 the date of reception and also of approval by the board of each of such application shall be note on the application paper
 5 exception from examination in the classified postal service be hereby make as follow
 a assistant postmaster
 b one private secretary or one confidential clerk of the postmaster
 c cashier
 d assistant cashier
 e superintendent designate by the post office department and report as such to the commission
 f custodians of money stamp stamp envelope or postal card designate as such by the post office department and so report to the commission for whose fidelity the postmaster be under official bond
 6 no person appoint to a place under any exception to examination hereby make shall within one year after appointment be transfer to another place not also except from examination but a person who have serve not less than one year in an examination except place may be transfer in the post office in which he be serve to a place not except from examination provide that before any such transfer may be make the commission must certify that the person whom it be propose to so transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place propose to be fill by such transfer
 postal rule iii
 1 the paper of every examination shall be mark under the direction of the commission and each competitor shall be grade on a scale of 100 accord to the general average determine by the mark make by the examiner on his paper
 2 the commission shall appoint in each classified post office a board of examiner which shall--
 a conduct all examination hold to test fitness for entrance to or promotion in the classified service of the post office in which the board be locate
 b mark the paper of such examination unless otherwise direct as provide for by general rule iii clause 12
 c conduct such examination for the classified departmental service as the commission may direct
 3 the paper of an examination having be mark the board of examiner shall ascertain--
 a the name of every competitor who have under section 1754 of the revised statutes claim of preference in civil appointment and who have attain a general average of not less than 65 per cent and all such competitor be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 b the name of every other competitor who have attain a general average of not less than 70 per cent and all such applicant be hereby declare eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold
 4 the name of all preference claim competitor whose general average be not less than 65 per cent together with the name of all other competitor whose general average be not less than 70 per cent shall be enter upon the register of person eligible to the class or place to test fitness for which the examination be hold the name of male and of female eligible shall be list separately
 5 the grade of each competitor shall be express by the whole number near the general average attain by he and the grade of each eligible shall be note upon the register of eligible in connection with his name when two or more eligible be of the same grade preference in certification shall be determine by the order in which their application paper be file
 6 immediately after the general average shall have be ascertain each competitor shall be notify that he have pass or have fail to pass
 7 if a competitor fail to pass he may with the consent of the board approve by the commission be allow reexamination at any time within six month from the date of failure without file a new application but a competitor fail to pass desire to take again the same examination must if not allow reexamination within six month front the date of failure make in due form a new application therefor
 8 no person who have pass an examination shall while eligible on the register supply by such examination be reexamine unless he shall furnish evidence satisfactory to the commission that at the time of his examination he be because of illness or for other good cause incapable of do himself justice in say examination
 9 the term of eligibility to appointment in the classified postal service shall be one year from the day on which the name of the eligible be enter on the register
 postal rule iv
 1 vacancy in the classified service of a post office unless among the place except from examination if not fill by either transfer or promotion shall be fill in the following manner
 a the postmaster at a post office in which a vacancy may exist shall in form and manner to be prescribe by the commission request the board of examiner to certify to he the name of either male or female eligible to the vacant place
 b if fitness for the place to be fill be test by competitive examination the board of examiner shall certify the name of three male or three female these name to be those of the eligible who stand higher in grade than any other three eligible of the same sex on the register from which certification be to be make have not be certify three time from said register provide that if upon say register there be the name of eligible who under section 1754 of the revised statutes have claim of preference in civil appointment the name of such eligible shall be certify before the name of other eligible higher in grade the commission shall make regulation that will secure to each of such preference claim eligible in the order of his grade among other preference claimant opportunity to have his claim of preference consider and determine by the appoint officer c each name on any register of eligible may be certify only three time
 2 of the three name certify to he the postmaster must select one and if at the time of make this selection there be more vacancy than one he may select more than one name each person thus designate for appointment shall be notify and upon report in person to the postmaster shall be appoint for a probational period of six month at the end of which period if his conduct and capacity be satisfactory to the postmaster he shall receive absolute appointment but if his conduct and capacity be not satisfactory to say officer he shall be notify that he will not receive absolute appointment and this notification shall discharge he from the service
 3 the postmaster of each classified post office shall require the superintendent of each division of his office to carefully observe and report in write the service render by and the character and qualification of each probationer serve under he these report shall be preserve on file and the commission may prescribe the form and manner in which they shall be make
 postal rule v.
 until promotion regulation shall have be apply to a classified post office promotion therein may be make upon any test of fitness determine upon by the postmaster if not disapprove by the commission provide that no employee shall be promote to any grade he could not enter by appointment under the minimum age limitation apply thereto by postal rule ii clause 2
 postal rule vi
 1 transfer may be make as follow
 a from one classified post office to another upon requisition of the postmaster general
 b from any classified post office to the post office department and from the post office department to any classified post office upon requisition of the postmaster general
 2 no person may be transfer as herein authorize until the commission shall have certify to the officer make the transfer requisition that the person whom it be propose to transfer have pass an examination to test fitness for the place to which he be to be transfer and that such person have be at least six month next precede the date of the certificate in the classified service of the department or post office from which the transfer be to be make
 postal rule vii
 upon the requisition of a postmaster the board of examiner for his office shall certify for reinstatement in a grade require no high examination than the one in which he be formerly employ any person who within one year next precede the date of the requisition have through no delinquency or misconduct be separate from the classified service in say office
 postal rule viii
 each postmaster in the classified postal service shall report to the board of examiners--
 a every probational and every absolute appointment and every appointment under any exception to examination authorize by postal rule ii clause 5 make in his office
 b every refusal to make an absolute appointment in his office and every refusal or neglect to accept an appointment in the classified service under he
 c every transfer into the classified service under he
 d every separation from the classified service under he and whether the separation be cause by dismissal resignation or death place except from examination be within the classified service
 e every restoration to the classified service under he of any person who may have be separate therefrom by dismissal or resignation
 these rule shall take effect march 1 1888

to the congress
 i have this day approve house bill no 11336 supplementary to an act entitle an act to execute certain treaty stipulation relate to chinese approve the 6th day of may 1882
 it seem to i that some suggestion and recommendation may properly accompany my approval of this bill
 its object be to more effectually accomplish by legislation the exclusion from this country of chinese laborer
 the experiment of blend the social habit and mutual race idiosyncrasy of the chinese labor class with those of the great body of the people of the united states have be prove by the experience of twenty year and ever since the burlingame treaty of 1868 to be in every sense unwise impolitic and injurious to both nation with the lapse of time the necessity for its abandonment have grow in force until those having in charge the government of the respective country have resolve to modify and sufficiently abrogate all those feature of prior conventional arrangement which permit the coming of chinese laborer to the united states
 in modification of prior convention the treaty of november 17 1880 be conclude whereby in the first article thereof it be agree that the united states should at will regulate limit or suspend the coining of chinese laborer to the united states but not absolutely prohibit it and under this article an act of congress approve on may 6 1882 see 22 u. s. statutes at large p. 58 and amend july 5 1884 23 u. s. statutes at large p. 115 suspend for ten year the coming of chinese laborer to the united states and regulate the going and come of such chinese laborer as be at that time in the united states
 it be however soon make evident that the mercenary greed of the party who be trade in the labor of this class of the chinese population be prove too strong for the just execution of the law and that the virtual defeat of the object and intent of both law and treaty be be fraudulently accomplish by false pretense and perjury contrary to the express will of both government
 to such an extent have the successful violation of the treaty and the law enact for its execution progress that the court in the pacific states have be for some time past overwhelm by the examination of case of chinese laborer who be charge with having enter our port under fraudulent certificate of return or seek to establish by perjury the claim of prior residence
 such demonstration of the inoperative and inefficient condition of the treaty and law have produce deep seat and increase discontent among the people of the united states and especially with those resident on the pacific coast this have induce i to omit no effort to find an effectual remedy for the evil complain of and to answer the earnest popular demand for the absolute exclusion of chinese laborer have object and purpose unlike our own and wholly disconnect with american citizenship
 aid by the presence in this country of able and intelligent diplomatic and consular officer of the chinese government and the representation make from time to time by our minister in china under the instruction of the department of state the actual condition of public sentiment and the status of affair in the united states have be fully make known to the government of china
 the necessity for remedy have be fully appreciate by that government and in august 1886 our minister at peking receive from the chinese foreign office a communication announce that china of her own accord propose to establish a system of strict and absolute prohibition of her laborer under heavy penalty from come to the united states and likewise to prohibit the return to the united states of any chinese laborer who have at any time go back to china in order in the word of the communication that the chinese laborer may gradually be reduce in number and cause of danger avert and life preserve
 this view of the chinese government so completely in harmony with that of the united states be by my direction speedily formulate in a treaty draft between the two nation embody the proposition so present by the chinese foreign office
 the deliberation frequent oral discussion and correspondence on the general question that ensue have be fully communicate by i to the senate at the present session and as contain in senate executive document o part 1 and 2 and in senate executive document no 272 may be properly refer to as contain a complete history of the transaction
 it be thus easy to learn how the joint desire and unequivocal mutual understanding of the two government be bring into articulate form in the treaty which after a mutual exhibition of plenary power from the respective government be sign and conclude by the plenipotentiary of the united states and china at this capital on march 12 last
 be submit for the advice and consent of the senate its confirmation on the 7th day of may last be accompany by two amendment which that body ingraft upon it
 on the 12th day of the same month the chinese minister who be the plenipotentiary of his government in the negotiation and the conclusion of the treaty in a note to the secretary of state give his approval to these amendment as they do not alter the term of the treaty and the amendment be at once telegraph to china whither the original treaty have previously be send immediately after its signature on march 12
 on the 13th day of last month i approve senate bill no 3304 to prohibit the coming of chinese laborer to the united states this bill be intend to supplement the treaty and be approve in the confident anticipation of an early exchange of ratification of the treaty and its amendment and the proclamation of the same upon which event the legislation so approve be by its term to take effect
 no information of any definite action upon the treaty by the chinese government be receive until the 21st ultimo the day the bill which i have just approve be present to i when a telegram from our minister at peking to the secretary of state announce the refusal of the chinese government to exchange ratification of the treaty unless further discussion should be have with a view to shorten the period stipulate in the treaty for the exclusion of chinese laborer and to change the condition agree on which should entitle any chinese laborer who might go back to china to return again to the united states
 by a note from the charge&#39 d&#39;affaire ad interim of china to the secretary of state receive on the evening of the 25th ultimo a copy of which be herewith transmit together with the reply thereto a third amendment be propose whereby the certificate under which any depart chinese laborer allege the possession of property in the united states would be enable to return to this country should be grant by the chinese consul instead of the united states collector as have be provide in the treaty
 the obvious and necessary effect of this last proposition would be practically to place the execution of the treaty beyond the control of the united states
 article i of the treaty propose to be so materially altered have in the course of the negotiation be settle in acquiescence with the request of the chinese plenipotentiary and to his express satisfaction
 in 1886 as appear in the document heretofore refer to the chinese foreign office have formally propose to our minister strict exclusion of chinese laborer from the united states without limitation and have otherwise and more definitely state that no term whatever for exclusion be necessary for the reason that china would of itself take step to prevent its laborer from come to the united states
 in the course of the negotiation that follow suggestion from the same quarter lead to the insertion in behalf of the united states of a term of thirty year and this term upon the representation of the chinese plenipotentiary be reduce to twenty year and finally so agree upon
 article ii be wholly of chinese origination and to that alone owe its presence in the treaty
 and it be here pertinent to remark that everywhere in the united states law for the collection of debt be equally available to all creditor without respect to race sex nationality or place of residence and equally with the citizen or subject of the most favored nation and with the citizen of the united states recovery can be have in any court of justice in the united states by a subject of china whether of the laboring or any other class
 no disability accrue from nonresidence of a plaintiff whose claim can be enforce in the usual way by he or his assignee or attorney in our court of justice
 in this respect it can not be allege that there exist the slight discrimination against chinese subject and it be a notable fact that large trading firm and company and individual merchant and trader of that nation be profitably establish at numerous point throughout the union in whose hand every claim transmit by an absent chinaman of a just and lawful nature could be completely enforce
 the admit and paramount right and duty of every government to exclude from its border all element of foreign population which for any reason retard its prosperity or be detrimental to the moral and physical health of its people must be regard as a recognize canon of international law and intercourse china herself have not dissent from this doctrine but have by the expression to which i have refer lead we confidently to rely upon such action on her part in cooperation with we as would enforce the exclusion of chinese laborer from our country
 this cooperation have not however be accord we thus from the unexpected and disappointing refusal of the chinese government to confirm the act of its authorized agent and to carry into effect an international agreement the main feature of which be voluntarily present by that government for our acceptance and which have be the subject of long and careful deliberation an emergency have arise in which the government of the united states be call upon to act in self defense by the exercise of its legislative power i can not but regard the express demand on the part of china for a reexamination and renew discussion of the topic so completely cover by mutual treaty stipulation as an indefinite postponement and practical abandonment of the object we have in view to which the government of china may justly be consider as pledge
 the fact and circumstance which i have narrate lead i in the performance of what seem to i to be my official duty to join the congress in deal legislatively with the question of the exclusion of chinese laborer in lieu of further attempt to adjust it by international agreement
 but while thus exercise our undoubted right in the interest of our people and for the general welfare of our country justice and fairness seem to require that some provision should be make by act or joint resolution under which such chinese laborer as shall actually have embark on their return to the united states before the passage of the law this day approve and be now on their way may be permit to land provide they have duly and lawfully obtain and shall present certificate heretofore issue permit they to return in accordance with the provision of exist law
 nor should our recourse to legislative measure of exclusion cause we to retire from the offer we have make to indemnify such chinese subject as have suffer damage through violence in the remote and comparatively unsettled portion of our country at the hand of lawless man therefore i recommend that without acknowledge legal liability therefor but because it be stipulate in the treaty which have fail to take effect and in a spirit of humanity befit our nation there be appropriate the sum of $ 276,619.75 payable to the chinese minister at this capital on behalf of his government as full indemnity for all loss and injury sustain by chinese subject in the manner and under the circumstance mention

to the congress of the united states as you assemble for the discharge of the duty you have assume as the representative of a free and generous people your meeting be mark by an interesting and impressive incident with the expiration of the present session of the congress the first century of our constitutional existence as a nation will be complete our survival for one hundred year be not sufficient to assure we that we no long have danger to fear in the maintenance with all its promise blessing of a government round upon the freedom of the people the time rather admonish we to soberly inquire whether in the past we have always closely keep in the course of safety and whether we have before we a way plain and clear which lead to happiness and perpetuity when the experiment of our government be undertake the chart adopt for our guidance be the constitution departure from the line there lay down be failure it be only by a strict adherence to the direction they indicate and by restraint within the limitation they fix that we can furnish proof to the world of the fitness of the american people for self government the equal and exact justice of which we boast as the underlie principle of our institution should not be confine to the relation of our citizen to each other the government itself be under bond to the american people that in the exercise of its function and power it will deal with the body of our citizen in a manner scrupulously honest and fair and absolutely just it have agree that american citizenship shall be the only credential necessary to justify the claim of equality before the law and that no condition in life shall give rise to discrimination in the treatment of the people by their government the citizen of our republic in its early day rigidly insist upon full compliance with the letter of this bond and see stretch out before he a clear field for individual endeavor his tribute to the support of his government be measure by the cost of its economical maintenance and he be secure in the enjoyment of the remain recompense of his steady and content toil in those day the frugality of the people be stamp upon their government and be enforce by the free thoughtful and intelligent suffrage of the citizen combination monopoly and aggregation of capital be either avoid or sternly regulate and restrain the pomp and glitter of government less free offer no temptation and present no delusion to the plain people who side by side in friendly competition work for the ennoblement and dignity of man for the solution of the problem of free government and for the achievement of the grand destiny await the land which god have give they a century have pass our city be the abide place of wealth and luxury our manufactory yield fortune never dream of by the father of the republic our business man be madly strive in the race for rich and immense aggregation of capital outrun the imagination in the magnitude of their undertaking we view with pride and satisfaction this bright picture of our country 's growth and prosperity while only a close scrutiny develop a somber shading upon more careful inspection we find the wealth and luxury of our city mingle with poverty and wretchedness and unremunerative toil a crowded and constantly increase urban population suggest the impoverishment of rural section and discontent with agricultural pursuit the farmer 's son not satisfied with his father 's simple and laborious life join the eager chase for easily acquire wealth we discover that the fortune realize by our manufacturer be no long solely the reward of sturdy industry and enlighten foresight but that they result from the discriminating favor of the government and be largely build upon undue exaction from the masse of our people the gulf between employer and the employ be constantly widen and class be rapidly form one comprise the very rich and powerful while in another be find the toil poor as we view the achievement of aggregated capital we discover the existence of trust combination and monopoly while the citizen be struggle far in the rear or be trample to death beneath an iron heel corporation which should be the carefully restrain creature of the law and the servant of the people be fast become the people 's master still congratulate ourselves upon the wealth and prosperity of our country and complacently contemplate every incident of change inseparable from these condition it be our duty as patriotic citizen to inquire at the present stage of our progress how the bond of the government make with the people have be keep and perform instead of limit the tribute draw from our citizen to the necessity of its economical administration the government persist in exact from the substance of the people million which unapplied and useless lie dormant in its treasury this flagrant injustice and this breach of faith and obligation add to extortion the danger attend the diversion of the currency of the country from the legitimate channel of business under the same law by which these result be produce the government permit many million more to be add to the cost of the living of our people and to be take from our consumer which unreasonably swell the profit of a small but powerful minority the people must still be tax for the support of the government under the operation of tariff law but to the extent that the mass of our citizen be inordinately burden beyond any useful public purpose and for the benefit of a favor few the government under pretext of an exercise of its tax power enter gratuitously into partnership with these favorite to their advantage and to the injury of a vast majority of our people this be not equality before the law the exist situation be injurious to the health of our entire body politic it stifle in those for whose benefit it be permit all patriotic love of country and substitute in its place selfish greed and grasping avarice devotion to american citizenship for its own sake and for what it should accomplish as a motive to our nation 's advancement and the happiness of all our people be displace by the assumption that the government instead of be the embodiment of equality be but an instrumentality through which especial and individual advantage be to be gain the arrogance of this assumption be unconceale it
